intro: Rhododendron sanguineum subsp. roseotinctum, commonly known as the rose-tinctured azalea, is a flowering shrub native to the western United States. It is characterized by its showy, pink to rose-red flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves are elliptical and dark green, providing a striking contrast to its vibrant blooms. It is a popular ornamental plant valued for its ornate floral display and adaptability to various garden settings.
